fields.summary: Support making additional 'LocalResources' available to running containers

fields.summary: Container worker dir could not recover when NM restart

comments.body:
IMO,by default when nm starts it will clear all workdirs, if we should skip some workdirs those container is recovering?
Any ideas?
When yarn.nodemanager.recovery.enabled is true, nm will not clear any workdir. However, container.workDir didn't recover and is null.
Upload a patch to fix this bug

This message was automatically generated.

Hi, [~jianhe], Could you help to review the patch.

We already have a problem, after NM restart,  we send a resource localization request while container is running(YARN-1503), then NM will fail because of the following exception.
Also, anywhere which use *container.workDir* may cause a NullPointerException.
{code}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Can not create a Path from a null string
        at org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path.checkPathArg(Path.java:159)
        at org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path.<init>(Path.java:175)
        at org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path.<init>(Path.java:110)
... ...
{code}

Hi, wy {code}ContainerRetryPolicy{code} is configuarable,for example if you are using DistributeShell app you can set this by parameter:*--container_retry_policy*.
IMO,{code}yarn.nodemanager.recovery.enabled=true{code} and {code}ContainerRetryPolicy= NEVER_RETRY{code} is not ambivalent.
I think ContainerRetryPolicy is create to let app control which container should retry which not.
For example in ApplicationMaster assemble ContainerLaunchContext, can set this.

Yes, yarn.nodemanager.recovery.enabled=true and ContainerRetryPolicy= NEVER_RETRY is is not ambivalent.

I mean container.workdir always need to be saved in NM state store, has nothing to do with ContainerRetryPolicy.
